name: Food Bank Volunteer Day
description: Help sort and distribute food to families in need
detailedDescription: Join our team at the community food bank to help organize donations, sort food items, and assist families. We need volunteers to help unload delivery trucks, stock shelves, and prepare food packages for distribution.
address: 100 Charity Street, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: Homeless Shelter Meal Service
description: Serve meals at the downtown homeless shelter
detailedDescription: We're looking for volunteers to help prepare and serve dinner at our shelter. Tasks include food prep, serving meals, and cleaning up afterward. This is a great opportunity to directly impact those experiencing homelessness.
address: 250 Hope Avenue, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: River Cleanup Day
description: Clean up trash along the Tennessee River
detailedDescription: Join us for our monthly river cleanup event. We'll provide gloves, trash bags, and tools. Help us keep our waterways clean and protect local wildlife. Dress for outdoor work and bring water.
address: River Walk Park, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: After School Tutoring Program
description: Tutor elementary students in math and reading
detailedDescription: Help students improve their academic skills through one-on-one tutoring. We need volunteers with patience and a passion for education. Training provided. Commitment of at least 2 hours per week for 8 weeks.
address: Lincoln Elementary School, 500 School Street, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: Virtual Health Fair Coordinator
description: Help organize and run online health education sessions
detailedDescription: Assist with our virtual community health fair. We need volunteers to help coordinate Zoom sessions, manage breakout rooms, and provide technical support to participants. Healthcare background helpful but not required.
address: Virtual Event

name: Animal Shelter Dog Walking
description: Walk and socialize shelter dogs
detailedDescription: Our shelter dogs need exercise and socialization! Volunteers will walk dogs, play with them in our outdoor area, and help with basic training. Orientation required before first shift.
address: Happy Paws Animal Shelter, 789 Pet Lane, Huntsville, AL 35802

name: Community Garden Planting Day
description: Help plant vegetables for community food distribution
detailedDescription: Join us for a morning of planting vegetables that will be distributed to local families. We'll be planting tomatoes, peppers, squash, and herbs. Tools and gloves provided. Bring water and sun protection.
address: Community Garden, 321 Green Street, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: Youth Mentorship Program
description: Mentor at-risk youth through weekly activities
detailedDescription: Become a positive role model for a young person. Mentors meet with their mentee for 2-3 hours per week for activities like sports, arts, homework help, or just talking. Background check and training required.
address: Youth Center, 456 Hope Road, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: Senior Center Bingo Night
description: Host bingo and socialize with seniors
detailedDescription: Bring joy to our senior residents by hosting our weekly bingo night. Help set up, call numbers, assist players, and engage in friendly conversation. Light refreshments will be served.
address: Golden Years Senior Center, 555 Elder Way, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: Emergency Preparedness Workshop
description: Learn and teach disaster preparedness skills
detailedDescription: Help educate the community about emergency preparedness. Volunteers will be trained on topics like creating emergency kits, evacuation planning, and first aid basics, then help present workshops to community groups.
address: Community Center, 200 Main Street, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: Thanksgiving Food Drive
description: Collect and distribute Thanksgiving meals to families
detailedDescription: Help collect, sort, and distribute complete Thanksgiving meal packages to families in need. We'll be providing turkeys, side dishes, and desserts. Heavy lifting required for loading and unloading.
address: Central Food Bank, 150 Charity Drive, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: Winter Clothing Distribution
description: Sort and distribute winter coats and clothing
detailedDescription: Help organize and distribute winter clothing to those in need. We'll be sorting donations by size, setting up distribution tables, and helping clients find appropriate cold-weather gear.
address: Warming Center, 275 Shelter Lane, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: Tree Planting Initiative
description: Plant native trees in local parks
detailedDescription: Join our reforestation effort! We'll be planting 100 native trees in city parks to improve air quality and provide shade. Tools, trees, and training provided. Wear sturdy shoes and clothes you don't mind getting dirty.
address: Riverside Park, 800 Park Drive, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: STEM Workshop for Girls
description: Lead science and technology activities for young girls
detailedDescription: Inspire the next generation of female scientists and engineers! Volunteers will help facilitate hands-on STEM activities including robotics, coding, chemistry experiments, and engineering challenges for girls ages 8-14.
address: Science Center, 333 Innovation Way, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: Mobile Health Clinic Support
description: Assist with mobile health screenings in underserved areas
detailedDescription: Support our mobile health clinic as it travels to underserved neighborhoods. Volunteers help with registration, patient flow, language interpretation, and providing health education materials. Medical background not required.
address: Various Locations, Huntsville, AL

name: Cat Socialization Program
description: Socialize shy cats to prepare them for adoption
detailedDescription: Help our shy and fearful cats become more comfortable with people. Volunteers will spend time gently interacting with cats, playing with toys, and helping them build confidence. Training session required before volunteering.
address: Feline Rescue Center, 900 Whisker Way, Huntsville, AL 35802

name: Neighborhood Watch Program
description: Help organize community safety initiatives
detailedDescription: Join our neighborhood watch program to help build safer communities. Volunteers will help organize meetings, distribute safety information, coordinate patrols, and serve as liaisons with local law enforcement.
address: Community Police Station, 400 Safety Street, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: Summer Reading Program
description: Lead reading activities for elementary students
detailedDescription: Help prevent summer learning loss by engaging children in fun reading activities. Volunteers will read aloud, facilitate book discussions, and organize literacy games. We provide all books and materials.
address: Public Library, 123 Book Lane, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: Senior Technology Classes
description: Teach seniors to use smartphones and computers
detailedDescription: Help bridge the digital divide by teaching seniors how to use technology. Topics include email, video calls, social media, online shopping, and staying safe online. Patient and friendly volunteers needed.
address: Senior Learning Center, 600 Technology Drive, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: Flood Recovery Cleanup
description: Help families recover from recent flooding
detailedDescription: Assist flood-affected families with cleanup and recovery efforts. Tasks include removing damaged items, mucking out basements, and salvaging belongings. Heavy work involved. Safety equipment provided.
address: Flood Zone Area, Various Addresses, Huntsville, AL

name: Weekend Meal Prep for Seniors
description: Prepare and package meals for homebound seniors
detailedDescription: Help prepare nutritious meals that will be delivered to homebound seniors. We need volunteers to help with cooking, portioning, packaging, and cleaning. Food handler certification helpful but not required.
address: Meals on Wheels Kitchen, 175 Service Road, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: Homeless Outreach Program
description: Connect homeless individuals with resources
detailedDescription: Join our street outreach team to connect homeless individuals with shelter, food, healthcare, and other services. Training provided on trauma-informed care and de-escalation techniques.
address: Outreach Center, 300 Compassion Street, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: Recycling Education Campaign
description: Teach community about recycling and waste reduction
detailedDescription: Help spread the word about proper recycling! Volunteers will staff information booths, distribute educational materials, and answer questions about what can and cannot be recycled in our community.
address: Farmers Market, 450 Market Street, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: College Application Workshop
description: Help high school students with college applications
detailedDescription: Mentor high school seniors through the college application process. Help with essay writing, FAFSA completion, scholarship searches, and answering questions about college life. College graduates preferred.
address: High School Guidance Office, 700 Scholar Way, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: Blood Drive Volunteer
description: Assist with community blood drive event
detailedDescription: Help make our blood drive a success! Volunteers greet donors, help with registration, serve refreshments, and monitor donors during recovery. We need friendly, organized volunteers who can stay calm in medical settings.
address: Community Center, 525 Donation Drive, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: Wildlife Habitat Restoration
description: Restore natural habitats for local wildlife
detailedDescription: Join conservation efforts to restore wetland and woodland habitats. We'll be removing invasive species, planting native vegetation, and building nesting boxes. Outdoor work with environmental impact.
address: Nature Preserve, 1000 Wildlife Road, Huntsville, AL 35803

name: Community Art Mural Project
description: Help paint a mural celebrating community diversity
detailedDescription: Be part of creating a beautiful community mural! No artistic experience necessary - we need painters of all skill levels. The mural will celebrate our community's diversity and history. Paint and supplies provided.
address: Unity Wall, Downtown Plaza, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: After School Sports Program
description: Coach youth in basketball and soccer
detailedDescription: Mentor youth through sports! Help coach basketball or soccer teams for children ages 8-14. Focus on skill development, teamwork, and sportsmanship. Coaching experience helpful but not required.
address: Recreation Center, 800 Sports Complex Drive, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: Senior Exercise Class
description: Lead gentle exercise sessions for seniors
detailedDescription: Help seniors stay active and healthy! Lead or assist with gentle exercise classes including chair yoga, stretching, and light aerobics. CPR certification preferred. Training provided on working with seniors.
address: Senior Wellness Center, 650 Fitness Lane, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: Emergency Shelter Setup
description: Help set up temporary emergency shelter
detailedDescription: Prepare for potential disasters by helping set up and test emergency shelter facilities. We'll be assembling cots, organizing supplies, and creating a welcoming space for those who might need emergency housing.
address: Emergency Operations Center, 250 Readiness Road, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: Food Rescue Program
description: Pick up and deliver surplus food to shelters
detailedDescription: Help reduce food waste while feeding the hungry! Volunteers with vehicles pick up surplus food from restaurants and grocery stores and deliver it to local shelters and food banks. Flexible scheduling.
address: Various Pickup/Delivery Locations, Huntsville, AL

name: Warming Center Night Shift
description: Overnight volunteer at emergency warming center
detailedDescription: Provide overnight support at our emergency warming center during cold weather. Duties include welcoming guests, monitoring facility, serving hot beverages, and ensuring safety. Training provided.
address: Warming Center, 350 Shelter Avenue, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: Stream Water Quality Testing
description: Monitor local stream health through water testing
detailedDescription: Become a citizen scientist! Learn to test water quality in local streams and report findings. We'll train you on testing procedures and equipment. Data helps protect our waterways. Monthly commitment preferred.
address: Various Stream Locations, Huntsville, AL

name: Literacy Program for Adults
description: Tutor adults in reading and writing skills
detailedDescription: Help adults improve their literacy skills in a supportive, judgment-free environment. One-on-one tutoring focused on reading, writing, and basic math. Training and materials provided. 2-hour weekly commitment.
address: Adult Learning Center, 400 Education Drive, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: Virtual Telehealth Support
description: Help patients connect to telehealth appointments
detailedDescription: Bridge the digital divide in healthcare! Help patients, especially seniors, connect to their telehealth appointments. Provide technical support, ensure privacy, and assist with basic device operation.
address: Health Clinic, 300 Medical Plaza, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: Barn Cat Care Program
description: Feed and care for community barn cats
detailedDescription: Help care for community barn cats that provide natural pest control. Duties include feeding, providing fresh water, cleaning feeding stations, and monitoring cat health. Outdoor work in all weather.
address: Community Farm, 1200 Rural Route, Huntsville, AL 35803

name: Block Party Organizer
description: Help plan and execute neighborhood block parties
detailedDescription: Build community connections! Help organize block parties including securing permits, coordinating food, planning activities, and setting up/cleaning up. Great for people who love bringing neighbors together.
address: Various Neighborhood Locations, Huntsville, AL

name: Teen Leadership Program
description: Mentor teens in leadership and life skills
detailedDescription: Guide teenagers as they develop leadership skills, career planning, financial literacy, and conflict resolution. Weekly meetings include discussions, activities, and guest speakers. Youth development experience helpful.
address: Youth Leadership Center, 550 Future Lane, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: Memory Care Activities
description: Lead activities for seniors with dementia
detailedDescription: Bring joy to seniors with memory challenges through music, art, reminiscence activities, and gentle exercise. Training provided on dementia care and communication techniques. Patient, compassionate volunteers needed.
address: Memory Care Facility, 700 Remembrance Way, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: Disaster Preparedness Supply Drive
description: Collect and organize emergency supplies
detailedDescription: Help build our disaster supply stockpile. Volunteers will organize donation drives, sort supplies, create emergency kits, and inventory items. We need batteries, flashlights, first aid supplies, water, and non-perishable food.
address: Emergency Warehouse, 150 Preparedness Drive, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: Community Breakfast Program
description: Prepare and serve breakfast to families in need
detailedDescription: Start your weekend by serving others! Help prepare and serve a hot breakfast to families experiencing food insecurity. Menu includes eggs, pancakes, fruit, and beverages. Kitchen volunteers and servers needed.
address: Community Kitchen, 225 Nourish Street, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: Job Skills Workshop
description: Teach resume writing and interview skills
detailedDescription: Help people experiencing homelessness prepare for employment. Volunteers will teach resume writing, conduct mock interviews, help with job applications, and provide professional clothing guidance.
address: Employment Services Center, 400 Opportunity Street, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: Butterfly Garden Creation
description: Plant and maintain a pollinator-friendly garden
detailedDescription: Help create a beautiful butterfly and pollinator garden! We'll be planting native flowers, installing a water feature, and adding educational signage. Perfect for nature lovers who want to support local ecosystems.
address: Nature Center, 850 Meadow Lane, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: ESL Conversation Partner
description: Practice English conversation with adult learners
detailedDescription: Help English language learners practice conversation skills in a relaxed setting. No teaching experience required - just patience and willingness to chat! We'll provide conversation topics and activities.
address: International Welcome Center, 500 Global Way, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: Community Health Screenings
description: Assist with blood pressure and health screenings
detailedDescription: Support our community health screening event. Volunteers will help with registration, record keeping, directing traffic, and providing health education materials. Medical students and healthcare workers especially welcome.
address: Community Clinic, 350 Wellness Drive, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: Pet Adoption Event
description: Help with pet adoption fair and meet-and-greets
detailedDescription: Make adoption dreams come true! Volunteers will help set up adoption booths, handle animals, process applications, and educate potential adopters about pet care. Animal handling experience preferred.
address: Pet Store Parking Lot, 600 Shopping Center, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: Community Garden Harvest Festival
description: Help organize harvest celebration and food distribution
detailedDescription: Celebrate the harvest! Help organize our community garden festival including harvesting vegetables, setting up distribution tables, live music, kids activities, and garden tours. Fun event for the whole community.
address: Community Garden, 321 Green Street, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: Homework Help Club
description: Provide after-school homework assistance
detailedDescription: Help students succeed! Provide homework help and tutoring in a supportive after-school environment. All subjects welcome. Perfect for college students, retired teachers, or anyone who loves helping kids learn.
address: Community Center, 450 Learning Lane, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: Senior Shopping Assistant
description: Help seniors with grocery shopping and errands
detailedDescription: Provide companionship and assistance to seniors who need help with shopping. Drive seniors to stores, help them shop, carry groceries, and ensure they get home safely. Must have reliable vehicle and clean driving record.
address: Various Locations, Huntsville, AL

name: Emergency Response Training
description: Get trained in emergency response and volunteer coordination
detailedDescription: Become a certified disaster response volunteer! This training covers emergency response basics, shelter operations, volunteer management, and crisis communication. Graduates join our rapid response team.
address: Training Center, 250 Readiness Road, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: Backpack Food Program
description: Pack weekend food bags for school children
detailedDescription: Help ensure children don't go hungry on weekends. Volunteers pack backpacks with child-friendly, nutritious food that students can take home for the weekend. Assembly-line style packing makes this fun and efficient.
address: Food Bank Warehouse, 175 Nourish Drive, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: Transition Housing Support
description: Help families moving into permanent housing
detailedDescription: Support families transitioning from homelessness to permanent housing. Help with moving, furniture assembly, cleaning, organizing, and setting up utilities. Make their new house feel like home.
address: Various Housing Locations, Huntsville, AL

name: Coastal Cleanup Trip
description: Day trip to clean beaches and coastal areas
detailedDescription: Join us for a day trip to clean Alabama's beautiful coastline! We'll provide transportation, supplies, lunch, and supervision. Help protect marine life by removing trash and debris from beaches and marshes.
address: Departure from City Hall Parking Lot, Huntsville, AL

name: GED Test Prep Classes
description: Tutor adults preparing for GED exam
detailedDescription: Help adults achieve their GED credential! Provide tutoring in math, science, social studies, and language arts. Materials and lesson plans provided. Teaching or tutoring experience helpful but not required.
address: Adult Education Center, 400 Second Chance Drive, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: Medical Equipment Lending
description: Maintain and distribute medical equipment to those in need
detailedDescription: Help people access medical equipment they can't afford to buy. Volunteers clean, repair, and organize wheelchairs, walkers, crutches, and other medical devices, then help match equipment with people who need it.
address: Medical Supply Warehouse, 300 Care Street, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: Foster Pet Care
description: Provide temporary foster care for shelter animals
detailedDescription: Open your home to animals in need! Foster homes provide temporary care for pets awaiting adoption, sick or injured animals recovering, or mother animals with babies. All supplies and vet care provided.
address: Your Home (Foster Program), Huntsville, AL

name: Tool Library Organizer
description: Maintain community tool lending library
detailedDescription: Help run our community tool library where residents can borrow tools for free. Volunteers check tools in/out, perform basic maintenance, organize the collection, and help patrons select appropriate tools.
address: Community Workshop, 500 Maker Street, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: Summer Camp Counselor
description: Lead activities at free summer day camp
detailedDescription: Make summer special for kids who can't afford traditional camps! Counselors lead games, crafts, sports, and educational activities at our free day camp. One week commitment. Training provided. High energy required!
address: Camp Location, 800 Summer Fun Drive, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: Friendly Visitor Program
description: Visit isolated seniors for companionship
detailedDescription: Combat loneliness in our senior community! Visit homebound seniors weekly for conversation, games, reading, or just company. Many seniors have no regular visitors. Your friendship can make all the difference.
address: Various Home Visits, Huntsville, AL

name: Hurricane Prep Workshop
description: Teach hurricane and severe weather preparedness
detailedDescription: Help educate the community about hurricane preparedness. Volunteers will be trained then help present workshops on evacuation planning, home protection, emergency supplies, and insurance considerations.
address: Emergency Center, 250 Readiness Road, Huntsville, AL 35801

name: School Supply Drive
description: Collect and distribute school supplies to students
detailedDescription: Help students start the school year ready to learn! Organize supply donations, sort items by grade level, pack backpacks, and distribute to families. Make sure every child has the supplies they need.
address: Distribution Center, 600 Education Way, Huntsville, AL 35801
